sub_topic: Predicting the products of inorganic reactions
message_1: A chemistry student needs to predict the products of a reaction between aluminum and sulfuric acid. What chemical equation represents this reaction and what are the names and states of the products formed?
message_2:
The reaction between aluminum (Al) and sulfuric acid (H₂SO₄) can be represented by the following balanced chemical equation:

2Al (s) + 3H₂SO₄ (aq) → Al₂(SO₄)₃ (aq) + 3H₂ (g)

In this reaction, solid aluminum (Al) reacts with aqueous sulfuric acid (H₂SO₄) to form aqueous aluminum sulfate (Al₂(SO₄)₃) and hydrogen gas (H₂).
